intro: Daphnopsis costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican daphnopsis, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its unique, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a glossy appearance. While not widely cultivated, it holds ecological significance in its native habitat.
